content:
Hi everyone. After what I believe was a successful import of a backup from another server into this new Ubuntu 18.04 server, I changed DNS for my domain and then tried to add a Let's Encrypt certificate using /home/zulip/deployments/current/scripts/setup/setup-certbot --email=EMAIL HOSTNAME [HOSTNAME2...]. This results in instant completion, with only this output:

+ CERTBOT_PATH=/usr/local/sbin/certbot-auto
+ wget -q https://dl.eff.org/certbot-auto -O /usr/local/sbin/certbot-auto

and nothing else happens. What am I missing?
I think we can forget about this for now. Even when I install with a self-signed certificate I am getting an internal server error. I'll come back to this sometime in the future.
@Steve Shank OK, thanks for the follow-up. As a sidenote, #production help is the best place for questions about a production installation.
This topic was moved here from #general > let's encrypt/certbot problem by Tim Abbott
